alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued November 13 at 6:23AM PST until November 13 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in areas of fog or freezing fog. * WHERE...Central Willamette Valley. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and potential frost on bridges. Major highways such as Interstate 5 and Highways 20 and 22 will be impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Visibility varies dramatically throughout the advisory area. Drivers should be prepared for sudden changes in visibility and road conditions. Frosty roads will provide an additional challenge for drivers, cyclists, and pedestrians.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Also, be alert for frost on bridge decks causing slippery roads. Cyclists and pedestrians should wear bright or reflective clothing to increase the chances of being seen by others.
